title: RIPE Community Discusses Need for Registry
overview: The Réseaux IP Européens (RIPE) community begins discussing the need for a European IP address registry, paving the way for RIPE NCC.

title: RIPE NCC Established
overview: RIPE Network Coordination Centre (NCC) is established in Amsterdam as the first Regional Internet Registry, serving Europe, Middle East, and parts of Central Asia.

title: APNIC Created
overview: Asia Pacific Network Information Centre (APNIC) is established in Tokyo, later headquartered in Brisbane, as the second Regional Internet Registry.

title: ARIN Created
overview: The American Registry for Internet Numbers (ARIN) is formed to serve North America and parts of the Caribbean, relieving InterNIC of regional allocation duties.

title: LACNIC Created
overview: The Latin America and Caribbean Network Information Centre (LACNIC) is established in Montevideo, Uruguay, to serve Latin America and parts of the Caribbean.

title: AFRINIC Created
overview: The African Network Information Centre (AFRINIC) is recognized as the fifth Regional Internet Registry, headquartered in Mauritius, serving the African continent.

title: APNIC Exhausts IPv4 Pool
overview: APNIC becomes the first RIR to exhaust its pool of freely available IPv4 addresses, moving to final-phase allocation policies.

title: ARIN Exhausts IPv4 Pool
overview: ARIN announces exhaustion of its IPv4 free pool, marking a milestone in North American IPv4 scarcity.

title: RIPE NCC Exhausts IPv4 Pool
overview: RIPE NCC announces it has made its final IPv4 allocations, officially running out of free IPv4 space in the RIPE region.

title: LACNIC & AFRINIC Enter Scarcity Phase
overview: The last two Regional Internet Registries, LACNIC and AFRINIC, enter scarcity phases with limited IPv4 availability under strict allocation policies.
